com.rigado.rigablue

Class RigLeConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rigado.rigablue.RigLeConnectionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRigCoreBluetoothCommon, IRigCoreBluetoothConnectionObserver

    public class RigLeConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRigCoreBluetoothConnectionObserver
    This class provides methods for managing connections to available Bluetooth devices. This class is a singleton and it is only accessed through the public static class method getInstance().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bluetoothDoesNotSupported()
      This callback is sent if Bluetooth Low Energy is not supported on this device or if the app does not have the appropriate permissions in its manifest.
      void bluetoothPowerStateChanged(boolean enabled)
      This callback is received if the system Bluetooth power state changes.
      void cancelConnection(RigAvailableDeviceData deviceToRemove)
      To clean up BluetoothGatt objects in a timely manner, you should cancel the connection if you have tried to connect to an available device, but have not yet received the actual base device in a connection callback.
      void connectDevice(RigAvailableDeviceData device, int timeout)
      Initiates a connection to the device.
      void connectionDidTimeout(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice)
      This method is sent by CoreBluetooth upon a connection request timeout.
      void didConnectDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice)
      This callback is delivered from the lower level Bluetooth APIs after a successful connection to a device.
      void didDisconnectDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice)
      This callback is received from the lower level Bluetooth API upon a device disconnection.
      void didFailToConnectDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice)
      This method is sent by CoreBluetooth upon a connection request failure.

      Disconnects from the device.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RigLeConnectionManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        Returns the singleton instance of this class

      • connectDevice

        public void connectDevice(RigAvailableDeviceData device,
                          int timeout)
        Initiates a connection to the device. After timeout, if the connection request has not completed successfully, the connection request will be cancelled.
        Parameters:
        device - The device to connect with
        timeout - The amount of time, in milliseconds, to give the connection request before it is cancelled.

      • cancelConnection

        public void cancelConnection(RigAvailableDeviceData deviceToRemove)
        To clean up BluetoothGatt objects in a timely manner, you should cancel the connection if you have tried to connect to an available device, but have not yet received the actual base device in a connection callback.
        Parameters:
        deviceToRemove - The RigAvailableDeviceData used in connectDevice Example: 
         
 if (rigLeBaseDevice != null) {
     connectionManager.disconnectDevice(rigLeBaseDevice);
 } else if (rigAvailableDeviceData != null) {
     connectionManager.cancelConnection(rigAvailableDeviceData);
 }

      • disconnectDevice

        public void disconnectDevice(RigLeBaseDevice device)
        Disconnects from the device.
        Parameters:
        device - The device to disconnect

      • getConnectedDevices

        public java.util.ArrayList<RigLeBaseDevice> getConnectedDevices()
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of the list of currently connected devices.

      • didConnectDevice

        public void didConnectDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice)
        This callback is delivered from the lower level Bluetooth APIs after a successful connection to a device. The observer of this class will be notified of the device connection.
        Specified by:
        didConnectDevice in interface IRigCoreBluetoothConnectionObserver
        Parameters:
        btDevice - The device to which the connection was made.

      • didDisconnectDevice

        public void didDisconnectDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice)
        This callback is received from the lower level Bluetooth API upon a device disconnection. The observer of this class will be notified of this event.
        Specified by:
        didDisconnectDevice in interface IRigCoreBluetoothConnectionObserver
        Parameters:
        btDevice - The device which disconnected

      • connectionDidTimeout

        public void connectionDidTimeout(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice)
        This method is sent by CoreBluetooth upon a connection request timeout. The observer of this class will be notified of this event.
        Specified by:
        connectionDidTimeout in interface IRigCoreBluetoothConnectionObserver
        Parameters:
        btDevice - The device for which the connection request timed out.

      • didFailToConnectDevice

        public void didFailToConnectDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice)
        This method is sent by CoreBluetooth upon a connection request failure. The observer of this class will be notified of this event.
        Specified by:
        didFailToConnectDevice in interface IRigCoreBluetoothConnectionObserver
        Parameters:
        btDevice - The device for which the connection request failed.

        public void setObserver(IRigLeConnectionManagerObserver observer)

        Parameters:
        observer - The observer to set

      • getObserver

        public IRigLeConnectionManagerObserver getObserver()
        Returns:
        Returns the current observer of this class

      • bluetoothPowerStateChanged

        public void bluetoothPowerStateChanged(boolean enabled)
        This callback is received if the system Bluetooth power state changes.
        Specified by:
        bluetoothPowerStateChanged in interface IRigCoreBluetoothCommon
        Parameters:
        enabled - If true, Bluetooth interface is enabled, disabled otherwise

      • bluetoothDoesNotSupported

        public void bluetoothDoesNotSupported()
        This callback is sent if Bluetooth Low Energy is not supported on this device or if the app does not have the appropriate permissions in its manifest.
        Specified by:
        bluetoothDoesNotSupported in interface IRigCoreBluetoothCommon
